original: Since old times, Japanese people have experienced natural disasters many times.
slashSplit: Since old times, / Japanese people have experienced natural disasters many times.
parenSplit: Since old times, Japanese people have experienced natural disasters many times.
vocabularySplit: + Since / + old / + times / , / + Japanese / + people / + have / + experienced / + natural / + disasters / + many / + times / .

original: They cannot be stopped because they come from nature.
slashSplit: They cannot be stopped because they come / from nature.
parenSplit: They cannot be stopped (because they come from nature).
vocabularySplit: + They / + cannot / + be / + stopped / + because / + they / + come / + from nature / .

original: When a typhoon is coming, weather reports show us which course the typhoon can take.
slashSplit: When a typhoon is coming, / weather reports show us which course the typhoon can take.
parenSplit: (When a typhoon is coming), weather reports show us which course the typhoon can take.
vocabularySplit: + When / + a / + typhoon / + is / + coming / , / + weather / + reports / + show / + us / + which / + course / + the / + typhoon / + can / + take / .

original: However, we cannot stop the typhoon.
slashSplit: However, / we cannot stop the typhoon.
parenSplit: However, we cannot stop the typhoon.
vocabularySplit: + However / , / + we / + cannot / + stop / + the / + typhoon / .

original: Also we cannot tell when and where the next earthquake will happen.
slashSplit: Also we cannot tell when / and where the next earthquake will happen.
parenSplit: Also we cannot tell when and where the next earthquake will happen.
vocabularySplit: + Also / + we / + cannot / + tell / + when / + and / + where / + the / + next / + earthquake / + will / + happen / .

original: Even the highest technology cannot help us avoid all these natural disasters.
slashSplit: Even the highest technology cannot help us avoid all these natural disasters.
parenSplit: Even the highest technology cannot help us avoid all these natural disasters.
vocabularySplit: + Even / + the / + highest / + technology / + cannot / + help / + us / + avoid / + all / + these / + natural / + disasters / .

original: Then what should we do to prepare for natural disasters?
slashSplit: Then what should we do / to prepare / for natural disasters?
parenSplit: Then what should we do to prepare <for natural disasters>?
vocabularySplit: + Then / + what / + should / + we / + do / + to prepare / + for natural disasters / ?

original: First, we need to get the right information about them.
slashSplit: First, / we need to get the right information / about them.
parenSplit: First, we need to get the right information <about them>.
vocabularySplit: + First / , / + we / + need / + to / + get / + the / + right / + information / + about them / .

original: Look at the graph.
slashSplit: Look / at the graph.
parenSplit: Look <at the graph>.
vocabularySplit: + Look / + at the graph / .

original: It shows the ways people want to use to get disaster information.
slashSplit: It shows the ways people want to use / to get disaster information.
parenSplit: It shows the ways people want to use to get disaster information.
vocabularySplit: + It / + shows / + the / + ways / + people / + want to / + use / + to / + get / + disaster / + information / .

original: According to the graph, many people want to use TV and radio for disaster information.
slashSplit: According / to the graph, / many people want to use TV / and radio / for disaster information.
parenSplit: According <to the graph>, many people want to use TV and radio <for disaster information>.
vocabularySplit: + According / + to / + the / + graph / , / + many / + people / + want to / + use / + TV / + and / + radio / + for disaster information / .

original: More than 80 percent of people chooose TV, and about 48 percent of people choose radio as a useful source.
slashSplit: More than 80 percent / of people chooose TV, / and / about 48 percent / of people choose radio as a useful source.
parenSplit: More than 80 percent of people chooose TV, and <about 48> percent of people choose radio as a useful source.
vocabularySplit: + More / + than / + 80 / + percent / + of people chooose TV / , / + and / + about 48 percent / + of people choose radio as a useful source / .

original: On the other hand, the graph shows that many people are trying to get the information on the Internet.
slashSplit: On the other hand, / the graph shows that many people are trying / to get the information / on the Internet.
parenSplit: <On the other hand>, the graph shows (that many people are trying to get the information <on the Internet>).
vocabularySplit: + On the other hand / , / + the / + graph / + shows / + that / + many / + people / + are / + trying / + to / + get / + the / + information / + on the Internet / .

original: More than 35 percent of people of people think that social media give them useful information.
slashSplit: More than 35 percent / of people / of people think / that social media give them useful information.
parenSplit: More than 35 percent of people of people think (that social media give them useful information).
vocabularySplit: + More / + than / + 35 / + percent / + of people / + of people think that social media give them useful information / .

original: It is also important for us to think of the things we can do now.
slashSplit: It is also important / for us / to think / of the things we can do now.
parenSplit: It is also important <for us to> think <of the things we can> do now.
vocabularySplit: + It / + is / + also / + important / + for / + us / + to think / + of the things we can do now / .

original: Actually, we can do a lot of things to prepare for natural disasters.
slashSplit: Actually, / we can do a lot of things / to prepare / for natural disasters.
parenSplit: Actually, we can do a lot of things to prepare <for natural disasters>.
vocabularySplit: + Actually / , / + we / + can / + do / + a lot of / + things / + to prepare / + for natural disasters / .

original: For example, many cities have made evacuation maps which show where to go in natural disasters such as big earthquakes.
slashSplit: For example, / many cities have made evacuation maps which show where / to go / in natural disasters such as big earthquakes.
parenSplit: For example, many cities have made evacuation maps which show where to go <in natural disasters> such as big earthquakes.
vocabularySplit: + For example / , / + many / + cities / + have / + made / + evacuation / + maps / + which / + show / + where to / + go / + in natural disasters / + such as / + big / + earthquakes / .

original: If we share the maps with our family or our neighbors, we can better.
slashSplit: If we share the maps / with our family / or our neighbors, / we can better.
parenSplit: (If we share the maps <with our family or our> neighbors), we can better.
vocabularySplit: + If / + we / + share / + the / + maps / + with our family / + or / + our / + neighbors / , / + we / + can / + better / .

original: Since old times, evacuation maps and drills have saved many people from natural disasters.
slashSplit: Since old times, / evacuation maps / and drills have saved many people / from natural disasters.
parenSplit: Since old times, evacuation maps and drills have saved many people from natural disasters.
vocabularySplit: + Since / + old / + times / , / + evacuation / + maps / + and / + drills / + have / + saved / + many / + people / + from natural disasters / .

original: Nobody can know when and where a natural disaster will happen.
slashSplit: Nobody can know when / and where a natural disaster will happen.
parenSplit: Nobody can know when and where a natural disaster will happen.
vocabularySplit: + Nobody / + can / + know / + when / + and / + where / + a / + natural / + disaster / + will / + happen / .

original: Today, we experience many big natural disasters, but we are too busy with our daily lives to think about them every day.
slashSplit: Today, / we experience many big natural disasters, / but we are too busy / with our daily lives / to think / about them every day.
parenSplit: Today, we experience many big natural disasters, but we are too busy <with our daily lives to> think <about them> every day.
vocabularySplit: + Today / , / + we / + experience / + many / + big / + natural / + disasters / , / + but / + we / + are / + too / + busy / + with / + our / + daily / + lives / + to think / + about them / + every day / .

original: However, it is important to get the right information and skills to prepare for natural disasters.
slashSplit: However, / it is important / to get the right information / and skills / to prepare / for natural disasters.
parenSplit: However, it is important to get the right information and skills to prepare <for natural disasters>.
vocabularySplit: + However / , / + it / + is / + important / + to / + get / + the / + right / + information / + and / + skills / + to prepare / + for natural disasters / .
